result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathan Diante Lawson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathan Diante Lawson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 137 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Court WAIVES all costs, fees and surcharges including DNA due to inability to pay

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Diante Lawson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) gj

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court sentences defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 137 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court waives all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA, due to inability to pay.
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in custody.  Patrick J. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case scheduled for final pretrial conference.  Parties have reached a resolution.    

As to Count 3 of the amended information, defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the state, court ordered Count 1 DISMISSED. 

Case adjourned for sentencing in branch 10.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office until sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense wishes to be heard as to bail.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial to Branch 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
-From the defendant; Received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-For Reduction of Bail from defendant; Received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Bail set at $1,600 CASH. Court ordered NO Justice Point. Maintain absolute sobriety. No weapons or firearms. No contact with victim(s).

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, in custody.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests scheduling date.  
All parties are advised effective July 31, 2017 case will be reassigned to Honorable Judge Michelle Havas, Branch 10, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 21, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 37 on June 14, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. Parties notified.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Vladimir M. Gorokhovsky in court.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance at today's scheduled plea hearing and requests stayed bench warrant.
State requests bench warrant be issued.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  Court will review.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court with attorney Vladimir M. Gorokhovsky.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense informs the Court that after review all the discovery materials, the motion he wanted to present is not viable.  Defense withdraws motion.    Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court with attorney Vladimir M. Gorokhovsky.  Brittany C Grayson for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has posted bail.  Bail motion moot.  Defense requests a Stop Motion.  Defense to file his motion papers by November 2, 2015.  State has until 11-16-15 to file their response.  Matter adjourned for Motion Hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM044943  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
10-03-2015

Attorney Vladimir M. Gorokhovsky in court, defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney requests a bail motion hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vladimir Gorokhovsky  in court, defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Defense counsel requests a pretrial conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, defendant in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Additional time needed to have counsel appointed.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, defendant in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was before this Court for status of counsel.  No appearances made.  Contact made with the public defenders office.  Defendant had private counsel, which withdraw on the previous court date.  Defendant was not Informed and needs to have this done.  As this Court is not in session and the public defenders office requires about 5 working days to appoint counsel, matter has been rescheduled for 8-10-15 @ 8:15 a.m. for Status of Counsel  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE STATUS OF COUNSEL IN BRANCH 21.

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Status of Counsel scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Parties still engaged in negotiations for global resolution; status date selected.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Discharge Summary Report, received and filed.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, in custody.  
Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense needs additional time to review discovery materials and offer; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report, received and filed.

Justice Point Status Update dated 3-20-15, received and filed.  

*defendant will be discharged from Justice Point program if still in custody as of 3-30-15*

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in custody.  Ron Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/9/15, filed in case #15CF649.
css
TURN OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and ALL other previously ordered terms/conditions REMAIN.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court to revisit the issue of bail due to Justice Point violations.  Hearing proceeded.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.  The Court modifies (lowers) cash bail to $100.00 same terms and conditions.  Case remains set for Preliminary Hearing on 3-10-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Preliminary Hearing Court.
TURN OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and ALL other previously ordered terms and conditions REMAIN.

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court.  ADA Benjamin Wesson present.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

*CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE*  Matter before the Court on walk-in basis to address JusticePoint violation report.  Parties in receipt of report.  ADA Wesson to stand silent in absence of defense attorney.  This clerk was unable to make contact with Attorney Avery Goodrich.  The Court sets bail at $150.00 CASH with same terms and conditions.  The Court to review this matter when defense counsel present; clerk to notify Attorney Goodrich.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Co- Defendant: Michael Phillips
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
